title: how to export Thunderbird emails to MBOX
creator: Richard403
content:
I am currently using Thunderbird 115.3.1 (64-bit). The about info shows that I can update to 115.10.1, however, I believe there are much later versions but I don't know if I can update to the latest. My MacOS is 10.15.7 and that is the latest I can install.

I have a large amount of email stored on my MAC and not in the cloud.

I want to be able to access these emails that are on my hard drive, in addition to Thunderbird, in Apple Mail.

I have researched and it appears that the best way is to export from Thunderbird is into the mbox format. However, there does not seem to be a way to do this in the version of Thunderbird I am using.

How do I move all of my local email in Thunderbird to my Apple Mail?

Thanks for any help, Richard

title: [RISOLTO] Problema importazione email backup
creator: rento1
content:
Ciao a tutti,

di recente ho migrato il mio sito su un nuovo server e, prima della migrazione, ho eseguito un backup del profilo di Thunderbird (utilizzo 3 account di posta).

Dopo la migrazione ho ricreato le caselle email e riconfigurato Thunderbird aggiornando le porte dei server e le password. Il client si riavvia e scarica regolarmente la posta senza problemi.

Il problema sorge quando provo a importare le email dal backup: viene creata una cartella locale chiamata "Import Thunderbird", ma al suo interno non compare nulla.

Per verificare se il backup fosse corrotto, ho provato a importare l‚Äôintero profilo salvato e in questo caso l‚Äôoperazione riesce. Tuttavia, non posso mantenerlo perch√© contiene le vecchie configurazioni. Appena aggiorno le impostazioni con quelle nuove, Thunderbird si riavvia e le vecchie email scompaiono.

Ho utilizzato sia l'estensione ImportExportTools NG per il backup dell‚Äôintero profilo, sia l‚Äôesportazione nativa di Thunderbird, seguendo la procedura indicata qui:

https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/importa-impostazioni-dati-Thunderbird

Qualcuno ha suggerimenti su come recuperare le vecchie email senza perdere le nuove configurazioni?

Grazie in anticipo!


---> non avevo visto questa guida che altri volontari hanno suggerito: https://radiofaro.neocities.org/kb/index/002

ho risolto grazie a questa. Grazi!

title: Archiving e-mail on NAS
creator: truenorth1
content: Hi, I hope someone can help me. I've been archiving my e-mail on my Synology NAS for a number of years now. However, my W10 desktop computer died last year and I've had to reinstall Thunderbird on a new W11 PC. I want to get access to all the archived e-mails on my NAS, that is, as they used to appear in Thunderbird under local folders year-by-year. I also want to be able to archive more recent e-mails to the same location. That is, I want to re-establish the same archiving process I had previously, complete with access to the old archives. I've tried to set up the same file path to the NAS under Local Folders in Thunderbird (as far as I can remember - I might not have it correct) but the old archives don't appear. in an attempt to identify the correct file path on the NAS, I've tried to archive a recent message as a test so I can see where it is stored - in Thunderbird the year folder appears under the NAS location under local folders as expected and I can see the message in the message window so it seems to be working but I can't see any new folders or files on the NAS - nothing modified or created with today's date. I'd be grateful for any assistance. Thanks, Kevin

My XML file:

<clientConfig version="1.1"> 

 <emailProvider id="christoph-haas.de">    <domain>christoph-haas.de</domain>    <displayName>Christoph's Mail Service</displayName>    <displayShortName>ISPmail</displayShortName>    <incomingServer type="imap">      <hostname>webmail.workaround.org</hostname>      <port>143</port>      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>      <username>%EMAILADDRESS%</username>    </incomingServer>    <outgoingServer type="smtp">      <hostname>webmail.workaround.org</hostname>      <port>587</port>      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>      <username>%EMAILADDRESS%</username>    </outgoingServer>  </emailProvider>

</clientConfig>

I fail to see any errors in here.

I even tried with the reference configuration from https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Autoconfiguration:ConfigFileFormat but it failed as well. (I just found that the <serverURL> tag is not properly closed but that was easy to fix.)

Has anyone here seen that effect as well? Should I file a bug?

Thanks for your time! ‚Ä¶Christoph

title: MIssing emails
creator: keithinoz1
content:
I have suddenly lost emails from 1 December to 12 February and many of my folders are now empty. I backup my computer nightly so I am able to go back up to six months ago. I have tried exchanging the profile folder in Appddata > Roaming and Local but when I start Thunderbird it looks like a clean install with nothing.

Is there anything else I need to bring back from my backups other than the profiles folder?
